title: [Kanban Migration] Wire up beads CLI integration
Add sub-category grouping to sidebar navigation
description:
As more sections are added, the sidebar is getting crowded. Add the ability to organize sections into collapsible sub-categories/groups.

Proposed categories:
- Personal (Profile, Settings, Setup)
- Development (API Playground, Jobs, AI Workspace)
- Entertainment (Daily Feed, potentially media players)
- Finance (Paper Trading/Stocks)
- Productivity (Quick Notes, Tasks, Bookmarks)
- Information (Weather, Search Hub, World Clocks)

Features to consider:
- Collapsible category headers
- Drag-and-drop to reorder sections within categories
- Settings to customize which category each section belongs to
- Remember collapsed/expanded state in localStorage
- Visual distinction between categories (subtle separators or indentation)

title: Split Projects page into Local Projects and GitHub Activity
description:
The Projects page currently combines both local projects and GitHub repos, which becomes overwhelming with many repos.

Proposed split:
- **Projects** → Focus on local projects only (~/projects/ directory)
- **GitHub Activity** → Already exists separately, enhance to include full repo browsing

Implementation tasks:
- Remove GitHub integration from projects-dashboard.tsx
- Keep local project scanning and display
- Ensure GitHub Activity section has adequate repo browsing/filtering
- Update navigation labels if needed
- Consider what metadata/features each section needs independently

comments.author: matt
comments.text:
Reference implementations to look at:

1. **~/projects/portfolio-style-guides** - git-dashboard page with nice styling

2. **~/projects/TabzChrome** - Source Control dashboard with:
   - Auto commit message generation using Haiku
   - Bulk sync operations (fetch/pull) for multiple projects at once

These could inform the GitHub Activity section enhancements or be merged into the local Projects view for git operations.

title: Migrate ai-kanban-board project into personal-homepage
description:
Migrate the beads-connected kanban board and TUI from ~/projects/ai-kanban-board into this project as a new section. This includes:
- Kanban board UI that connects to beads issues
- TUI interface for terminal-based access
- Integration with the existing beads setup

This is a larger task that needs to be broken down into subtasks once requirements are clearer.
close_reason: Broken down into 8 subtasks (658, ce7, 9y5, ch8, p8f, y4d, 0d3, 8kb)

comments.author: matt
comments.text:
Add a launch icon to the Projects kanban pages that spawns the beads TUI:

```bash
cd /home/matt/projects/ai-kanban-board && ./tui/ai-kanban-tui
```

This could use the existing terminal spawning integration (useTerminalExtension hook) to open the TUI in a new terminal tab.

title: Eye icon on Setup wizard step 2 doesn't toggle on/off when clicked
description: The password visibility toggle (eye icon) on Setup wizard step 2 (API Keys) doesn't toggle the visibility state when clicked. The icon should switch between show/hide states and toggle the input field between password and text type.
close_reason: Fixed: Added z-10 to eye icon toggle buttons for proper click handling

title: [Kanban Migration] Copy shared UI components (badges, cards, indicators)
close_reason: Implemented: Copied shared UI components (PriorityBadge, AgentBadge, AgentCard, TimeEstimate, ContextIndicator) from ai-kanban-board to app/components/kanban/shared/

close_reason: Implemented: Migrated Zustand stores, TypeScript types, and hooks from ai-kanban-board to app/components/kanban/

title: [Kanban Migration] Migrate task modal and chat components
Investigate TabzChrome new tab search bar for Search Hub enhancements
description:
The TabzChrome new tab page has a search bar that matches against multiple sources:
- Bookmarks
- Terminal profiles
- And more

This works really well and could inform enhancements to the Search Hub section or provide a unified quick-launch experience.

Reference: ~/projects/TabzChrome new tab page implementation

title: Investigate integrating portfolio-style-guides media pages
description:
Explore feasibility of adding the music-player, video-player, and photo-gallery pages from ~/projects/portfolio-style-guides into personal-homepage.

These pages have nice styling and could potentially be:
- Combined into a unified media section
- Wired up to use local system files/directories
- Integrated with existing theme system

This is an investigation task to assess:
- What would need to change to integrate them
- How to handle local file system access
- Whether they should be separate sections or combined
- Any dependencies or conflicts with existing code
